intro: Amphiscopia retusa, commonly known as the smooth amphiscopia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are smooth and not hairy. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia and thrives in moist, shady environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
